intro: Sida calyxhymenia, commonly known as the silky sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces, and its small, pale yellow flowers are clustered in racemes. It produces small, round, greenish-brown seeds enclosed in a capsule. Sida calyxhymenia is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in warm, humid climates.
